articles.title: Neighbors call cops on black realtor showing home to black dad, son - New York Post
articles.description: Cops in Wyoming, Michigan, are backpedaling after handcuffing two African-American men and a 15-year-old African-American teen for touring a house for sale.
articles.content:
Cops in Wyoming, Michigan, are backpedaling after handcuffing two African American men and a 15-year-old African American teen for simply touring a house for sale.

articles.title: The FDA hasn’t approved 3rd COVID-19 booster shots. Some in U.S. are getting them anyway - Global News
articles.description: An untold number of Americans have managed to get third doses by taking advantage of the nation's vaccine surplus and loose tracking of those who have been fully vaccinated.
articles.content: When the delta variant started spreading, Gina Welch decided not to take any chances: She got a third, booster dose of the COVID-19 vaccine by going to a clinic and telling them it was her first shot… [+5565 chars]

articles.title: Joseph Gordon-Levitt has finished filming, but doesn't want to leave Wellington - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: The American actor has finished working on his latest series, made in Wellington, but he's yet to pack his bags.
articles.content:
Its Joseph Gordon-Levitt, sitting in a strange little room somewhere in Miramar.
 Kia ora, he says, in front of a grape-coloured wall.
 Im just really happy to be here.

articles.title: Draymond Green has message for world after Team USA's gold-medal win - NBC Sports Bay Area
articles.description: Winning gold was a bit tougher for the Americans in the Tokyo Olympics, but they are still kings.
articles.content:
Draymond Green and Team USA still are kings on the international stage.
